title.value: Chest Pain (CP) / Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) Documentation Template
Cardiology: Chest Pain (CP) / Coronary Artery Disease (CAD) Clinical Content White Paper

description.value: Clinical Content White Paper

title.value: American Heart Association Risk Caclulator
Cardiovascular Disease (10-year risk)

description.value: Outcome CVD (coronary death, myocardial infarction, coronary insufficiency, angina, ischemic stroke, hemorrhagic stroke, transient ischemic attack, peripheral artery disease, heart failure)

citation.value: Cardiovascular disease (10-year risk) [Internet].: Framingham Heart Study; cited 2017]. Cardiovascular Disease (10-year risk). Available from: https://www.framinghamheartstudy.org/risk-functions/cardiovascular-disease/10-year-risk.php.

title.value: General cardiovascular risk profile for use in primary care: the Framingham Heart Study

description.value: BACKGROUND: Separate multivariable risk algorithms are commonly used to assess risk of specific atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (CVD) events, ie, coronary heart disease, cerebrovascular disease, peripheral vascular disease, and heart failure. The present report presents a single multivariable risk function that predicts risk of developing all CVD and of its constituents.

citation.value: D'Agostino RB S, Vasan RS, Pencina MJ, Wolf PA, Cobain M, Massaro JM, et al. General cardiovascular risk profile for use in primary care: the Framingham Heart Study. Circulation. 2008 February 12;117(6):743-53

title.value: 2014 ACC/AHA/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS focused update of the guideline for the diagnosis and management of patients with stable ischemic heart disease: A report of the american college of cardiology/american heart association task force on practice guidelines, and the american association for thoracic surgery, preventive cardiovascular nurses association, society for cardiovascular angiography and interventions, and society of thoracic surgeons

description.value: A report of the American College of Cardiology/American Heart Association Task Force on Practice Guidelines, and the American Association for Thoracic Surgery, Preventive Cardiovascular Nurses Association, Society for Cardiovascular Angiography and Interventions, and Society of Thoracic Surgeons

description.value: Population 18 years old or older
Adult with stable chest pain being considered for cardiology consultation (excluding unstable symptoms and acute coronary syndromes)
Provider in a Primary Care Clinic
Primary Care

def.name: priorCardiacDiagnosticProcedures
def.elm:annotation: Results of prior cardiac diagnostic procedures performed (resting ECG, echocardiogram, stress testing (echo, nuclear, MRI), CCT or angiography)

title.value: Clinical Stability Assessment

description.value: This documentation template is not applicable for unstable patients

prompt.value: Ongoing resting chest pain for > 20 minutes with ST elevation or depression on ECG
Onset of new resting chest pain episodes within the past week
New onset, recurrent chest pain with minimal exertion over the past 2 months
Previously stable exertional angina now occurring with minimal activity over the past 2 months

textEquivalent.value: This documentation template is not applicable for use with patients who are unstable based on clinician judgement. Examples of unstable patients include, but are not limited to, patients with chest pain pattern suggestive of ACS (e.g., those with new onset resting CP, CP with minimal exertion, new unstable angina pattern, ST-segment elevation, non–ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction on ECG, or suspected aortic dissection), and patients with any of the following symptoms or findings:
The user will complete this section for a patient determined to be unstable.

prompt.value: Rationale for determining that the patient was unstable, noting that the patient was transferred to the nearest emergency department immediately.

title.value: For a stable patient: The user will continue with the documentation template.
Coronary Artery Disease Risk

textEquivalent.value: Provide a link to the American Heart Association Risk Calculator

For this documentation template, please assess the patient’s 10-year cardiovascular disease risk using either clinical judgement or a risk calculator such as that provided by the AHA. Patient’s 10-Year Cardiovascular Disease Risk

title.value: History and Physical

prompt.value: History of prior cardiac evaluations (e.g., prior hospitalization or evaluations for: chest pain, rule/out MI, angina, heart failure, etc.)
Results of prior cardiac diagnostic procedures performed (resting ECG, echocardiogram, stress testing (echo, nuclear, MRI), CCT or angiography)
Physical Exam, Pertinent Positive and Negative Findings
Details of previous invasive diagnostic procedures and resulting interventions (e.g., angiography, PCI/Stents, or CABG)

title.value: Treatment Provided
Laboratory Studies

description.value: Each item in this section needs to include an expression, and a model (phenomenon testing result, thyroid result testing function measurement date within an interval of now to two years ago

prompt.value: Basic Metabolic Profile Lab Result between now and up-to 2 years ago
Complete Blood Count Lab Result between now and up-to 2 years ago
Lipid Profile Lab Result between now and up-to 2 years ago
Thyroid Function Testing Lab Result between now and up-to 2 years ago
Troponin Lab Result between now and up-to 2 years ago
Brain Natriuretic Peptide Lab Result between now and up-to 2 years ago
D-dimer Lab Result between now and up-to 2 years ago

title.value: Imaging and Diagnostic Studies

description.value: Images and diagnostic studies older than one year are not considered for inclusion in this documentation template. For this documentation template, the following information should be included, if available from the prior 1 year. Image and result text should be attached automatically if they are is provided for the 12-Lead Electrocardiogram Interpretation field.
Attach or link Images: 12-Lead Electrocardiogram
Attach or link Results: 12-Lead Electrocardiogram
Attach or link results: Stress Electrocardiography
Attach or link images: Stress Electrocardiography
Attach or link images: Resting Echocardiogram/Doppler
Attach or link results: Resting Echocardiogram/Doppler
Attach or link images: Stress Echocardiogram
Attach or link results: Stress Echocardiogram
Attach or link images: Stress MPI
Attach or link images: Stress MPI Interpretation
Attach or link Results: Rest MRI
Attach or link images: Rest MRI Interpretation
Attach or link Results: Stress MRI
Attach or link images: Rest MRI Interpretation
Attach or link images: Chest CT images
Attach or link images: Coronary/Cardiac CTA images
Attach or link results: Chest CT results
Attach or link results: Coronary/Cardiac CTA results
Attach or link images: X-Ray Chest Interpretation
Attach or link results: X-Ray Chest Interpretation
